pr_title: Added example of using OpenSSL to generate keys in the JWT RBAC docs

timeline.bodyText:
@nderwin Thanks for this update, IMHO it would be better to keep it not as one of the main subsections, but as a Note, Generating Keys with openssl, as generating the keys with openssl is not necessarily what the users will generally do and have this note immediately under the private key pem example, instead of injecting (or use the privateKey.pem file from <<Generating Keys>>) (otherwise we;ll also need to do the same for the public key).
So have this note and suggest in the end that you can use the generated pair of keys instead of the keys used in this quickstart (qualified better if preferred), something like this:
<<private key used in the demo>>
We will use a `smallrye.jwt.sign.key-location` property to point to this private signing key.

[NOTE]
====
the note from your PR about openssl

You can use the generated pair of keys instead of the keys used in this quickstart.
====

Does it sound reasonable ?
timeline.author: sberyozkin

replies.bodyText: Sure!  I'll make those changes and update the PR shortly.
replies.author: nderwin

timeline.bodyText: Please use 2048 as the keys used in the demo are 2048 bit length AFAIK as well (if you'd like, please add a comment that one can increase this value to 4096/etc)
timeline.author: sberyozkin
